privacy.title: Privacy & Security
privacy.description: All PDF processing is done locally in your browser. Your files are never uploaded to any server, ensuring complete privacy and security.

noRegistration.title: No Registration Required
noRegistration.description: Use all our tools without creating an account or providing any personal information.

localProcessing.title: Local
localProcessing.description: All files are processed directly in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

noStorage.title: No File Storage
noStorage.description: We don't store your files. Once you close the browser tab, all data is automatically cleared.

processingInfo.title: About File Processing Methods
processingInfo.localShort: Files are processed only in your browser, ensuring data privacy and security
processingInfo.serverShort: Files are encrypted and sent to our servers for processing, offering advanced features, and deleted immediately after processing
processingInfo.localDescription: Tools marked with 'Local' run entirely in your browser. Your files are not uploaded to any server, ensuring maximum privacy and security. Ideal for sensitive documents or quick processing of smaller files.
processingInfo.serverDescription: Tools marked with 'Server' require uploading files to our servers for processing. These tools offer more sophisticated features (like PDF to Word conversion), but processing time may be longer. Files are deleted immediately after processing and are never permanently stored.

steps.step1: Click the upload area or drag and drop images
steps.step2: Add multiple images and adjust the order
steps.step3: Select desired PDF quality (low, medium, or high)
steps.step4: Adjust page settings (paper size, orientation, etc.)

tips.tip1: Medium quality offers a good balance between file size and image clarity
tips.tip2: You can drag images to change their order in the PDF
tips.tip3: The watermark feature can help protect your image copyright

faqs.a1: Our tool supports all common image formats, including JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP, etc.
faqs.q2: How many images can I convert at once?
faqs.a2: While there's no strict limit, we recommend processing no more than 50 images at once for best performance.
faqs.q3: Are my images uploaded to a server?
faqs.a3: No. All processing happens in your browser, and your images are not uploaded to any server, ensuring your privacy.

pdfCompare.howItWorksDescription: This tool uses advanced PDF comparison algorithms to analyze content, layout, and format differences between two PDF files. The system identifies text changes, additions or deletions, as well as image and format changes, and highlights these differences in the comparison result.
pdfCompare.privacyNote: Note: All processing is done in your browser, files are not uploaded to any server, ensuring your data privacy and security.
pdfCompare.comparisonComplete: Comparison complete, please check the results

errors.missingFiles: Please upload two PDF files to compare

pdfCompare.title: How to Compare Two PDF Files

steps.step4: View the comparison results, with differences highlighted
steps.step5: You can download the comparison result PDF

tips.tip1: Ensure both PDF files have similar structures for best comparison results
tips.tip2: Use fullscreen mode for clearer difference viewing

faqs.q1: What types of differences can the comparison tool identify?
faqs.a1: Our comparison tool can identify text changes, added or deleted content, as well as image and formatting changes.
faqs.q2: How long does it take to compare large documents?
faqs.a2: Comparison time depends on document size and complexity. Large documents may take several minutes.

tips.tip1: Higher compression levels may affect image quality

faqs.q1: How much can a PDF be compressed?
faqs.a1: Compression rates vary depending on the content of your PDF. Documents with many images can often be reduced to 20-40% of their original size.

pdfToWord.title: How to Convert PDF to Word Document

steps.step2: Preview the PDF content to confirm
steps.step4: Wait for the conversion to complete

tips.tip1: Simpler PDF content results in higher conversion quality
tips.tip2: PDFs with complex tables and charts may require some manual adjustments after conversion
tips.tip3: Ensure the PDF text is selectable, not a scanned image

faqs.q1: Does the converted Word document retain the original PDF formatting?
faqs.a1: Our conversion tool strives to preserve original formatting, including fonts, colors, and layout, but complex elements may require some manual adjustments.
faqs.q2: Is there a file size limit?
faqs.a2: Generally, we recommend uploading PDFs under 20MB for optimal conversion performance and speed.
faqs.a3: To provide high-quality conversion, PDF files are securely uploaded to our servers for processing but are not stored or used for any other purpose. If your file contains sensitive information, we recommend using local processing tools.

pdfToExcel.title: How to Convert Tables from PDF to Excel

steps.step1: Upload your PDF file containing tables
steps.step2: Preview the PDF content to confirm it has table data
steps.step4: Wait for the conversion to complete (larger files may take longer)

tips.tip2: Complex merged cells may need adjustment after conversion
tips.tip3: Ensure tables in your PDF are text, not images

faqs.q1: Is the data in Excel editable after conversion?
faqs.a1: Yes, the converted Excel file is fully editable, and you can manipulate the data just like any regular Excel file.
faqs.q2: Can I extract multiple tables from a PDF?
faqs.a2: Yes, our tool can identify multiple tables in a PDF and convert them into different worksheets in Excel.
faqs.q3: What if tables in my PDF are scanned images?
faqs.a3: Our tool primarily handles text-based tables. For scanned table images, conversion accuracy may be reduced.

pdfToImage.title: How to Convert PDF to Images

steps.step3: Select conversion settings (image format, quality, and resolution)
steps.step5: Wait for the conversion to complete
steps.step6: Download all images or select individual ones to download

tips.tip1: PNG format is best for PDFs with text and lines, maintaining clarity
tips.tip2: JPEG format is suitable for PDFs with photo content, resulting in smaller files
tips.tip3: Increasing resolution gives clearer images but larger file sizes

faqs.q1: How many pages of PDF can I convert at once?
faqs.a1: There's no strict limit on the number of pages, but PDFs with many pages may require more processing time and browser memory. We recommend processing documents under 50 pages at a time.
faqs.q2: What's the quality of the converted images?
faqs.a2: Image quality depends on your chosen settings. Higher resolution and quality settings produce clearer images but with larger file sizes.
faqs.a3: Yes, all conversion is done in your browser, with no files uploaded to any server, ensuring file security and privacy.

faq.pageDescription: Find answers to common questions about our free PDF tools, including security, features, and technical support.
faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our PDF tools. If you don't find the information you need, feel free to contact us.
faq.contactUs: If you didn't find the answer you need, feel free to contact us. We're happy to help!

answers.free: Yes, all our PDF tools are completely free to use with no hidden fees or premium features. We believe in providing accessible tools for everyone.
answers.security: Your data is completely secure as all processing happens locally in your browser. Your files are never uploaded to any server, ensuring maximum privacy and security.
answers.mobile: Yes, our tools are designed to work on both desktop and mobile devices. However, for complex operations or large files, we recommend using a desktop for the best experience.
answers.fileSize: Since all processing is done in your browser, limitations depend on your device's capabilities. Generally, files up to 100MB work well, but larger files may require more processing time or memory.

questions.processingTime: How long does it take to process a PDF?

questions.whyBrowser: Why choose browser-based processing instead of server processing?
questions.browsers: What browsers do I need to use these tools?
questions.largeFiles: Why are some large files processed slowly?
questions.issues: What should I do if I encounter issues while using the tools?
